text:
When providing an initial parameter to a JSP page - it always returns null. 
This does work however for servlets.

Here is a sample JSP page
<%@ page language="java" %>
<%@ page import="javax.naming.*" %>
<html>
<body>
<%
	
String contextFactory = config.getInitParameter("initial.context.factory");
String providerURL = config.getInitParameter("provider.url");


%> 

Initial.Context.Factory:<%= contextFactory %>
Provider.URL:<%= providerURL %>
</body>
</html>


WAR web.xml file snippet 
	<servlet>
		<servlet-name>XXX</servlet-name>
		<display-name>XXX</display-name>
		<jsp-file>XXX.jsp</jsp-file>
		<init-param>
			<param-name>initial.context.factory</param-name>
			<param-value>com.xxx.ejb.InitialContextFactory</param-
value>
		</init-param>
		<init-param>
			<param-name>provider.url</param-name>
			<param-value>iiop://localhost:9000</param-value>
		</init-param>
	</servlet>



TIA
Mike
creator: mike.barlotta@aegis.net
remm@apache.org
text:
Just like for a servlet, you also have to define a servlet-mapping. Otherwise,
your request gets mapped to the default JSP servlet, which has no such init
parameters.
